intro: Preslianthus, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Preslianthus species are often found in high-altitude regions, thriving in cooler and more humid environments. They are valued for their ornamental beauty and have cultural significance in some indigenous communities.
